reviews.text:
Simple yet cozy set-up.  Good food with affordable price.  Lite version of Thai cuisine.  Tom Yum soup and Kang Kong dish is a big plus.  Thai milk tea üëçüèªüëçüèª
Definitely recommended.

Located along Agape Village in Lorong 8. Quite out of the way to be honest if you do not know the area well. They were severely shorthanded on a weekday with probably only one staff in the kitchen and one at the counter.

Regardless, they tried their very best to serve the dishes asap with a waiting time of less than 20minutes. The steamed fish was a huge standout for me - super fresh and generous portion at only $12.80. Not too salty or fishy too. Pad Thai was average. Green Curry chicken was a little too spicy. Thai stuffed chicken was average too. Wanted to try the chicken cutlet but it was sold out rather quickly. Their thai milk tea came in a huge cup and was rather generous without much ice added too. Worth the try overall although I wished the menu could be expanded slightly (maybe add a pineapple fried rice?).

Carpark spaces limited. Seating also quite limited at maybe 30-40 pax. They serve breakfast and toasts as well apparently.

New Thai restaurant located at Agape Village. Yummy pad thai, basil pork rice and stuffed chicken wings. Reasonable prices. Nice cold aircon. Nice clean environment.  Pleasant staff too.

Opening hours 8am to 930pm. They serve lunch from 11am.
Breakfast items are served till 5pm.

Some free parking lots available. Else can park at paid HDB parking across the building.

Food was great!
My family of 5 ordered tomyum prawn soup, fried kang Kong, steamed fish, fried chicken, moopeng, minced meat omelette, tomyum noodle, iced coffee and iced Thai milk tea.. food were so good we polished all. My top 3  fav were tomyum prawn soup, fried kang Kong and moopeng. All the Staff were polite and helpful.they were super busy yet never failed to serve with smiles on their faces.

Located in the same building as Agape Village.
The crispy fried kang kong is oily to seniors like me. Perhaps have a non-deep fried version?
Red Tom Yum Soup with Prawns was tasty.
